result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Guldan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Guldan

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): S.N.W. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:49 pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears, and with Attorney Adam Fontana. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 

Attorney Fontana is moving to DISMISS and makes argument. 
Court is holding issue open and asks defense to file a Motion. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.N.W. except for incidental contact. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
